Is there a word for the lag time between logging into Twitter, seeing all the stuff about babies and bombs, and working out wtf happened?
@strongmisgiving i am disappointed by the second sentence there
Last ever Blind Poetics was great. An unsung hero in the Edinburgh poetry scene. https://t.co/2v0Ma3R08E
@LeylaJosephine1 it can be excruciating depending on circumstance
@strongmisgiving Okay. What information do I need to know that makes this comprehensible?
@SKBwrites cheers! i hope i get to read the rest of your story.
@edmorrish it's forever teetering on the comedy/tragedy divide down there

@edmorrish have you ever read the customer reviews on that site?

If someone asks you to do a gig at @InterrobangEdin, do a gig at @InterrobangEdin - great line ups and audience. https://t.co/rsD4AtS5yf
@chrisdonia we do blur into each other
@poetryshower69 likewise, clocked you and @weecalrobot but I still haven't got the hang of basic human interactions like saying hi

@denofgeek you should look at @moriartyenterto if you haven't already
@thermoso I'm so happy it is a thing.

@strongmisgiving @Josherick3 shark backs are shiny
@strongmisgiving interesting, I wondered how far you'd have to go to jump the shark
@freelance_liar see @InterrobangEdin for updates and that.
Here's a thing I'm doing on Saturday in Leith with some people who are really really good at readings things out https://t.co/XYM6w6NcWG
@panieldiper compare it to a failed relationship that you aren't fully over, add a dick joke in before a moment of pathos, done.
Going to this because it is relevant to my interests/looks mint. https://t.co/N9NDoKmmDF
@MarianneMacRae have reserved them at the library.
@MarianneMacRae I will look these out at the libraries. Dave described the winner to me and I eventually went 'Meh'.

Considering forming a political party called "We are actively trying to kill you" just to see if I'd get my deposit back
An Edinburgh Watch never boils.
@strongmisgiving @CJMacBeathW @BexFoxwood and that Edinburgh watch rose again on the third day according to the twitters
@poetryshower69 @mitchellljade @KevinPGilday you should do that. with props.
@davepoems Kate Kellaway: the origin story #possiblepamphletnames
@jamiesmart if you ever feel ready, I think it's also on Netflix
@jamiesmart do Sing Street next
@strongmisgiving mind that joke we had 'In a war between page and performance poets - AND IT IS A WAR'
Last night I had a dream about buying the wrong size of cross dowel.
@triplebozzmun it's worse than Shark Zone
@stugone I can't make that promise.
@stugone I expect I will not be the last, but only if ross is reading this.
@stugone I can wait for you to pretend block someone else first if you like
@BexFoxwood no, but if you like crying it has its moments.
@strongmisgiving that would be cheaper, certainly
@strongmisgiving no, but we should make this film
@BexFoxwood have you seen 'A Monster Calls'?
@freelance_liar after about eighty minutes it becomes clear that what this means is, in fact, the sea.
The worst film I've ever seen with the word 'Shark' in the title is called 'Shark Zone'.
We are going to watch a film called 'Shark Exorcist'.
@strongmisgiving haven't we all
Never felt so close to self service checkouts as when they repeat "Awaiting approval"
@FredRAlexander #joebidenmemesagainstthedyingofthelight

@dohoodle I think I've seen that. It's got a surprisingly good cast.

@adfinnes how have you made this worse
@alantwentyseven some of them have evolved beyond blood
@freelance_liar this is actually quite an optimistic tweet because it presupposes a lack of nuclear armageddon/the collapse of civilisation
The year is 2046. Scott Brown has come out of retirement. Strachan thinks this is our year. We fail to qualify for the 106 team World Cup.
@callumjodwyer we'll be dead by the time this escalates into bloodshed, but its our future generations I feel sorry for
@KevinPGilday have you found the belgian beer for about 90 cents a bottle in the supermarkets yet?
@empowermint they're great fun but they've also generated their own cliches pretty rapidly
@strongmisgiving @Josherick3 @etherwaves especially gallus weegies
@empowermint the MCU
Sigourney Weaver is doing a Lis Sladen impression in A Monster Calls. There are also many other reasons to watch it.
@davepoems a short list poem

Bored on the bus, picked up the Metro. The next day on page 3: "BORED MAN PICKS UP THE METRO" #LossLit
@Josherick3 he's opened my eyes
I saw Coolio working in Spar. He was arguing with his manager about the mark-up on salt and vinegar twirls.
The bus driver refused to let the sunrise on, working to a timetable and besides there wasn't space #LossLit
Come to think of it, before Jeff moved to Midsomer, he did have a sort of cloying melancholy to him #LossLit
I just found my diary from 2013. There's nothing in it. I can probably spin a fringe show out of this.
@freelance_liar I used to do stand up.
There's nothing on the telly. Literally nothing. It yawns. It becomes so attractive your neck snaps in its pull. #LossLit
Due to inflation, forty winks only actually worth twenty nine of your parents' winks #LossLit
@strongmisgiving @stugone evocative, certainly, but it's not that good.
@strongmisgiving schedule this for loss lit
@strongmisgiving everyone else around the fire continues weeping for their lost futures
